title: Is there a difference between a being and a human being? - Quora

response.answer_text: Personally I would say that a being is the person, that is separate from their body and mind, the soul or spirit that moves from one life to the next. A Human Being is being that is being a human. If you consider the possibility of other life out there in the universe, then there are other types of bodies that are not human, so a being could be a different being, then human.

Yes, a being is any living thing. It would be anything that we could call “alive”, that has DNA. A human being is an individual of the species, homo sapiens. We could get into a more philosophical debate about the meaning of “being” for extra Earth purposes but I assume you meant not including aliens?
